subject: Science
title: The 2011 Japan Earthquake
description: Learn The 2011 Japan Earthquake in one minute.

hook.text: On March 11, 2011, a magnitude 9.1 earthquake struck off the coast of Japan.

buildup.text: The Pacific Plate lurched 50 meters beneath Japan in a matter of seconds.

discovery.text: The quake shifted Earth's axis by 10 cm and shortened the day by microseconds.

twist.text: But the earthquake itself wasn't the deadliest part. The tsunami was.

climax.text: Waves up to 40 meters tall overwhelmed seawalls and killed over 18,000 people.

punchline.text: The quake was historic. The wave was devastating. Japan rebuilt.

quiz.question: What made the 2011 Japan disaster so deadly?
options: Volcanic eruptions triggered by the quake
